required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on July 28, 2020
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.official_title: Observational Study to Detect Postoperative Residual Curarization in Infantile Patients

brief_summary.textblock: The primary object of this study is, to investigate the current procedure of neuromuscular monitoring at a tertiary academic university medical center.

detailed_description.textblock:
Residual neuromuscular block is known to be a significant but frequently overlooked complication after the use of neuromuscular blocking agents. Aim of this prospective, observational study is to detect the incidence and severity of residual paralysis at a tertiary academic german university medical center.
Methods:
All infantile patients recieving neuromuscular blocking agents are included over a 12 week observational period. At the end of the operation procedure, directly prior to tracheal extubation a train-of-four ratio was assessed quantitatively by an independet observer using the TOF Watch SX monitor. Data related to patient postoperative outcome were collected in the operating theatre, during the way to the postoperative care unit (PACU) and during the stay in the PACU:
- incidence of residual paralysis
- incidence of aspiration, bronchospasm, laryngospasm, oxygen desaturation, airway obstruction,

primary_outcome.description: Rate of residual paralysis after extubation of the infantile patients measured by acceleromyography.

secondary_outcome.description: Clinical assessment of the upper airway
Measurement of the oxygen saturation by pulse oxymetry

intervention.description: At the End of Surgery, shortly before Extubation, the TOF-Ratio is measured by an independent investigator using Acceleromyography.

study_pop.textblock: All children/youths between 1 Month to 18 years who are undergoing general anaesthesia with muscle relaxation due to surgical or diagnostical procedures.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- General aneasthesia with muscle relaxation
- Children between 1 Month to 18 Years
- Endotracheal Intubation due to surgical or diagnostical procedures
Exclusion Criteria:
- older than 18 years
- local aneasthesia
- regional aneasthesia
- larynx mask
- patient comes from ICU
- children who are not planned to be extubated

overall_official.affiliation: University medical center Regensburg, Department of anaesthesiology

responsible_party.investigator_title: Principal Investigator, Dr. med. Christoph Unterbuchner, Staff Anaesthesiologist
